definition: low pressure/depression (meteorology)
low/beneath/to lower (one's head)/to let droop/to hang down/to incline
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
see 壓根兒|压根儿[ya4 gen1 r5]
to press/to push down/to keep under (control)/pressure

sentences.english: It is feasible that both exhaustion and wetting by steam fog are carried out in the chamber with low pressure.
sentences.chinese: 低氣壓室中既抽真空又用蒸汽霧溼潤是可行的。

sentences.english: Specialist marine forecasting and surf camera service Coastalwatch said a rare weather event and the closeness of the low pressure system was the reason for the ocean's violence.
sentences.chinese: 和低氣壓系統是這次海岸暴力現象的起因。

sentences.english: Pink indicates a tropical depression and dark purple indicates a Category 3 storm.
sentences.chinese: 粉色顯示了熱帶低氣壓，深紫色顯示了3級風暴。

sentences.english: Wish this tropical cyclone will not strengthen to be a typhoon.
sentences.chinese: 希望此一熱帶低氣壓不會增強成爲颱風。

sentences.english: They are caused by a very low-pressure area.
sentences.chinese: 它是由很低的低氣壓區形成的。

sentences.english: But low-pressure weather systems are moving into Europe and Scandinavia.
sentences.chinese: 但是低氣壓天氣系統正進入歐洲和斯堪的納維亞。

sentences.english: Custom engineered systems are available for high or low-pressure applications.
sentences.chinese: 自定義特製工程系統可用於高氣壓或低氣壓情況。

sentences.english: It's just because of the lower pressure.
sentences.chinese: 只是由於低氣壓的緣故。

sentences.english: A depression usually brings bad weather.
sentences.chinese: 低氣壓通常帶來壞天氣。

sentences.english: Fluorescent is a low pressure mercury-smoke arc discharge lamp.
sentences.chinese: 日光燈是一種低氣壓的汞蒸氣弧光放電燈。

definition: the mountain road twists around each new peak (idiom)/(of a mountain road) twisting and turning/fig. an opportunity has come unexpectedly/things have taken a new turn
to be drowned (figurative and literal)
important matter that must be kept secret (idiom); don't breathe a word of it to anyone!
lit. wind sighing and crane calling (idiom)/fig. to panic at the slightest move/to be jittery
urban heat island effect
to shoot accidentally while polishing a gun/(fig.) a minor incident that sparks a war
after the calamity, renewed life (idiom); new lease of life
monsoon
to march straight in unchallenged (military) (idiom)/(fig.) to push deep into the heart of sth/to flood in
grazing land/pasture
to undergo change in weather/restoration of reactionary rule or the previous regime
seize every minute and second (idiom); not a minute to lose/every moment counts
chain reaction
exclusive property/forbidden domain
trench/moat
air mass
